ReviewList.Text: As most of the Dummies series, this book on physics is written for those who are interested in science, but not looking for deep physical theory. As part of the series of two books, this is the essential piece of science necessary to expose the basics of motion, gravity, and other physical phenomenon.
This math and science helpful guide arrived on time and is an excellent way to study for my high school physics class.

I bought this for a non-science major physics course for added help.  While it did add some information that the text didn't clarify, I ended up buying an even simpler version of this book for my Kindle that was a lot less money than I paid for this book.

Dr. Holzner knows his physics! I bought this book to reintroduce me to physics before I started engineering school after a four-year absence from school. It requires no calculus, and it reviews the laws that you will cover in an introductory physics class. He writes it in a very clear, understandable, and sometimes humorous way. I passed the exam to skip the first (algebra-based) physics class, to go straight into the calculus-based physics. That's what I needed from the book and it delivered.

I teach Physics and our school does not have a physics text book since we do most of the course work on line. I needed a simple way to fill in the gaps for what we were getting on line and what we were doing in the classroom. The Physics for Dummies series was a great resource. The exercises were practical and easy for the students to understand. I really like the relationship between the books and the workbook. This has been really useful for my students.
Just what somebody who last took a physics course in 1963 needed.  I need the background because I want to go on to Relativity and Dark Matter and Dark Holes.
In combination with Chemistry for Dummies, a friendly introduction to atoms, elements, mass, energy - and thermodynamics. Quite accessible from my Kindle Fire.

Don't get this expecting that you are going to be a physics master coming out of this, but if you are looking for a cheat book for physics essentials, then this is the one for you.  I really like the Dummies books, and this is a good addition.
The book arrived in very good condition and has helped me prepare for my next class. I now know what to expect in my next class and will use it as guidance through this class and my next one too.
Dummies books are awesome.  They take the most convoluted subjects and simplfy them to easily understood reading.  I am addicted to Dummies books for all subjects
For those who studied physics long time ago, this book is very good to remind and recall what is Physics.
Didn't go as far as I would have liked. Can't remember if it had si units or imperial?
My son said this book was a good goto guy for review in his class!
Excellent review in an easy to read format.

It was OK. I wanted just a theoretical overview of principles of physics. This gave an overview but went far more into the mathematical explanation of vectors than I wanted or needed. I had a hard time finding anything in the reviews that matched my precise need.This was a lot more mathematically-detailed than other "Dummies" books that I have gotten. I suppose that was the purpose of this book, but it was just more than I needed. If you want the mathematical equations and explanations, this is fine, but if you just want a basic overview without getting bogged down with the math, you may want to keep looking.
Excellent !
thank you
love it
Quick to ship. Brand new. Ordered another book with this one and I'm still waiting! Go figure. It's all about being timely other wise I could just buy it in a store. Thank you!

The Kindle version of this book displays all text blocks with a white background (I use Kindle for PC).  If you prefer a white-text-on-black-background, such as for reading in low-light situations, you will not be able to read the text.  I find this limitation unusable.
